reviewText: My friend, Art Clarke, died in 2008, after a prolonged illness, at the age of 90-trips around our Sun. Historians will remember him as the great inventor of future science fact as infused in his science fiction writings. His invention of the Earth orbiting satellite system we have today for example, and of course many of the features that are part of our spacestation, as shown in his 2001 Space Odyssey films, and more to come. A most modest and peace loving person, who is sorely missed.
